description: The 'Blue Pearl' known for its vibrant blue-washed houses and narrow streets in the Rif Mountains.
One of the largest mosques in the world, featuring intricate tilework, a retractable roof, and stunning ocean views.
A bustling central square in Marrakech, filled with food stalls, snake charmers, acrobats, and a variety of local performers.
Dramatic canyons carved by the Dades River, offering scenic hikes, waterfalls, and kasbahs (traditional fortified villages).
Roman ruins of an ancient city, showcasing impressive mosaics, temples, and triumphal arches.
Vast desert landscape with towering sand dunes, popular for camel trekking and stargazing under clear skies.
A spectacular canyon with towering cliffs along the Todgha River, perfect for hiking and exploring.
A laid-back coastal town with beautiful beaches, a relaxed atmosphere, and a well-preserved medina (old town).
The tallest waterfalls in Morocco, surrounded by lush greenery and offering breathtaking views.
A 17th-century fortress with beautiful gardens and panoramic views of the blue-washed city.
